meanings.definition: The first agricultural produce of a season, given as an offering to God.
meanings.sent1: The farmer brought the firstfruit of his harvest to the temple.
meanings.sent2: The community celebrated the firstfruit of the year with a special ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The priest accidentally tripped over the basket of firstfruit, causing a comical scene.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was the firstfruit of her generous nature.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the firstfruit filled the air, signaling a bountiful harvest.

meanings.definition: The earliest or most important result or reward of an endeavor.
meanings.sent1: Receiving the award was the firstfruit of his hard work.
meanings.sent2: The promotion was considered the firstfruit of her dedication to the company.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected bonus was a delightful firstfruit of his new job.
meanings.sent4: The firstfruit of their collaboration was a successful product launch.
meanings.sent5: The firstfruit of her savings was a well-deserved vacation.

meanings.definition: The first in a series or sequence.
meanings.sent1: The firstfruit of the numbers series is 1.
meanings.sent2: In the alphabet, 'A' is the firstfruit of the letters.
meanings.sent3: The firstfruit of the colors in the rainbow is red.
meanings.sent4: The firstfruit of the days of the week is Sunday.
meanings.sent5: The firstfruit of the months in a year is January.
